history.text: Hi! How are you doing today?
I'm great, and yourself?
Great! Have you seen Batman vs. Superman?
Yes I did! Did you see it in the theater or on demand/dvd/blu ray?
DVD, what did you think?
I saw it in the theater, I had high expectation for it, but I was a bit unsure since it was a new batman cast.  Did you read the comic or watch the cartoon?
I did! Loved the comic but was very disappointed by the movie. Seems consistent with what the reviews of the movie are. Do you agree?
I agree, they really hyped it up to be a huge fight and I thought it was anti climactic.  On the upside, they had some great acting, but it still will never be on par with Christopher Nolan's trilogy
Never, although I do love Amy Adams. I found Lex's character pretty awful.
She was pretty good as usual.  I actually liked Jesse Eisenberg as Lex Luthor it was a fresh character.
What was your favorite scene?
Asides from the ending?  I would say the scene with the batmobile it was interesting to see how Zack Snyder envisioned that.
what about yours?
I did enjoy the conflict between Batman and Superman and seeing them try to ruin eachother.

That was a great scene too, I felt as if it could have definitely lasted longer though since the whole film was basically centered around the two fighting. It will be interesting to see how they do another batman film.
Do you think taht they will?
It seems like they left it open for debate there were a few things I think fans questioned like what the story was with the bat suit covered in haha spray paint
Fair point. I also really enjoyed watchign Batman realize that he was so far gone.
Yeah, Ben Affleck did a good job portraying an older batman who was willing to push the envelope?  Didnt he kill or come close to killing several people in the movie?
Yeah, very close. But he did redeem himself by rescuing Martha.

Yeah i suppose that was his get out of jail free card. I also liked how he branded people, it was a huge step away from the previous batman's.  By far, it is on the same level as batman and robin, I was pretty bummed.
Do you typically like Superhero movies?
Usually. I prefer the DC over Marvel though since they are a bit more realistic.
That's fair.
WHat did you think of the scene where Batman grieving over Superman's death?

They almost set it up for a sequel, everyone knows you can't kill a major super hero off like that and just end it like that.  And the end scene with Lex Luthor in jail, theres no way it ends like that, he needs his revenge on super man.
What did you think of them having Zod appear again?

Michael Shannon did a great job playing Zod in Man of Steel.  I really enjoyed the comic, it was well written and the story was unique.  It really addressed something a lot of DC fans wanted to know who would win? Batman or Superman.  The execution of the movie was poor though, it was a bit too drawn out and the fight scene could have been a lot better.  What didn't you like about the movie?
I just thought that overal, it wasn't great. I agreed with the review that gave it a 4.9/10.
